issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When building the Titanium SDK (ie: titanium_mobile) on Mac, the Android NDK will build the C/C++ library with the {{-j8}} command line argument. This enables "parallel execution" of up to 8 build tools to be ran in parallel, allowing for faster build times.

On Windows, this feature is purposely disabled due to file locking errors caused by dependency order and code generation issues in the make file. These issues should be resolved for faster build times on Windows.
fields.summary: Android: Support faster SDK builds with parallel execution '-j' on Windows

comments.body:
*Closing ticket.*

Builds on windows were ~3 minutes which is over half the time it previously took.

*ENV*

{noformat}
macOS(10.14)
Windows 10 Pro (15063)
Appc NPM: 4.2.13
Appc CLI: 7.0.6
Ti CLI: 5.1.1
Node: 8.12.0
NPM: 6.4.1
{noformat}
